TIL that one of Germany’s biggest supermarket chains will stop producing printed marketing flyers this year. Their main argument is the climate and the numbers are insane:

Yearly savings:

- 390.000 m3 of wood
- 70.000 tons of CO2
- 380.000.000 kWh of electric energy

It’s the CO2 equivalent of roughly 60.000 ICE cars and the energy could power 100.000 4-person households for a year 🤯

title: Signal would 'walk' from UK if Online Safety Bill undermined encryption

last_post.content: Message scanning is a highly intrusive form of mass surveillance which would be introduced by the #onlinesafetybill it risks services like Signal and WhatsApp pulling out of the UK. You will lose the ability to communicate securely and privately. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-64584001

Remember the ua-fediland.de situation?

Apparently, there are attempts at hijacking another #Ukrainian #Mastodon #instance, this time social.mykolayiv.dcomm.net.ua.

The MO is similar: The #trolls try to establish contact to as many random #Fediverse users as possible and use these contacts to antagonise #Ukraine. The difference this time is that public access to the profiles of all accounts is blocked. This makes trolls easy to detect: If you can't access their profile, block them.

The admin, @InsiderUA, is aware of the situation and taking countermeasures already. However, part of the trolling tactics is to create new accounts and dynamite-fish for contacts when nobody is there to moderate.

Again, I advise against defederating the instance. This exactly is the attackers' goal. Don't give them what they want!

See also here:

title: AI search engines are not your friends

last_post.content:
Language models are problematic because we assume that something that can talk to us is also sentient. It's impossible not to anthropomorphize these chat bots. That creates all sorts of potential problems that you don't get with traditional UIs that are clearly machines. It remains to be seen if all these conversational interfaces really turn out to be useful, or just neat tech demos.

This is a pretty good article talking about this too: https://www.theverge.com/23601763/bing-ai-search-guilt-trip-emotional-manipulation

For fans of obscure date formats, the Julian Date reaches 2460000.0 in just four hours from now.

The Julian Date is defined as the number of days since noon Universal Time on 1st January 4713 BC in the Julian calendar. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_day Not to be confused with Excel's internal date format which is the number of days since 1st January 1900 https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/date-systems-in-excel-e7fe7167-48a9-4b96-bb53-5612a800b487

Tomorrow I'll be joining Hugo Bowne-Anderson at Outerbounds for a fireside chat and AMA on NLP from prototype to production 🧠

We'll cover:
▪️ what NLP in production actually means
▪️ trends & patterns in NLP use cases across industries
▪️ what skills data scientists and ML engineers need to build end-to-end NLP systems
▪️ what all the hype around large language models is, such as GPT-3, and how they can deliver real value in the world of NLP

[2301.00250] DensePose From WiFi

Advances in computer vision and machine learning techniques have led to significant development in 2D and 3D human pose estimation from RGB cameras, LiDAR, and radars. However, human pose estimation from images is adversely affected by occlusion and lighting, which are common in many scenarios of interest. Radar and LiDAR technologies, on the other hand, need specialized hardware that is expensive and power-intensive. Furthermore, placing these sensors in non-public areas raises significant privacy concerns. To address these limitations, recent research has explored the use of WiFi antennas (1D sensors) for body segmentation and key-point body detection. This paper further expands on the use of the WiFi signal in combination with deep learning architectures, commonly used in computer vision, to estimate dense human pose correspondence. We developed a deep neural network that maps the phase and amplitude of WiFi signals to UV coordinates within 24 human regions. The results of the study reveal that our model can estimate the dense pose of multiple subjects, with comparable performance to image-based approaches, by utilizing WiFi signals as the only input. This paves the way for low-cost, broadly accessible, and privacy-preserving algorithms for human sensing.

https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.00250

title: Bird flu death in Cambodian child sparks global alarm

last_post.content:
I've been following #H5N1 avian influenza for twenty years.

Today's news of a young girl's death from H5N1 in Cambodia is tragic and the news that 4 of 12 contacts are showing influenza-like symptoms is worrisome.

It's not time to panic yet by any means—we've seen similar events a number of times—but obviously we'll be watching closely.

Whatever happens, we need to be taking steps *now* to bolster rapid production capacity for cellular H5N1 vaccines such as Audenz.

Memo to #MNPS: Let Teenagers Sleep

"Teenagers need about nine hours of sleep a night—but they get closer to seven. And around puberty, their circadian clocks shift by a couple of hours, meaning they get tired later at night than before and wake up later in the morning than they used to. This shift reverses at adulthood. The biological nature of this daily rhythm means that sending a teenager to bed earlier won’t necessarily mean they fall asleep earlier."
